title: Typeface possibly used for subheads in old newspaper
content:
Hi,

I'm wondering if anyone can help me identify this typeface from the following article on the Internet:

[http://www.bloodyelbow.com/2011/10/31/2521315/the-forgotten-golden-age-o...](http://web.archive.org/web/20130823225634/http:/www.bloodyelbow.com/2011/10/31/2521315/the-forgotten-golden-age-of-mixed-martial-arts-part-iv-ultimate "http://www.bloodyelbow.com/2011/10/31/2521315/the-forgotten-golden-age-of-mixed-martial-arts-part-iv-ultimate")

If you scroll down a little you'll see the attached image.

To me, it looks like it was an image of a subheads from an old newspaper articles and then integrated into the design of the page for a faux aged effect.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130823225634im_/http:/typophile.com/files/wrestler_v_boxer_3825.png)

Thanks!
author: bfingeroth

comments.content: To me, it looks like strike-on type, possibly from a Varityper machine, in which case it is highly unlikely that it has been digitized…
